intro: Echinocereus klapperi subsp. bacanorensis, commonly known as the Bacanora hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the Sonoran Desert region of Mexico. It is a small, columnar cactus with a distinctive rib structure and spiny areoles. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers during the spring and summer months. Its roots are adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in arid environments. It is often found growing in rocky soils and is relatively easy to care for in cultivation.
